JobFullDesc: In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace. Work you'll do Responsible for supporting OBIEE development by devising or modifying procedures to solve complex problems considering the system environment and design. Responsibilities include program design, coding, testing, debugging and documentation to support the deployment of BI reports, dashboards, KPIs and models. Experience in analyzing source system data and business requirements while working with technical and business representatives to determine logical data models is required. Responsibilities also include optimizing the performance of reports, monitoring and maintaining the BI environment, and working with the functional team and other teams to understand the business process, functional design, and source data.The team Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights. Qualifications  Required:  Bachelors of Science degree in related field  2 years professional experience  Familiarity with enterprise ETL tools such as ODI  Experience implementing data warehousing solutions in an Oracle 11g/12c/19c environment  Strong SQL skills  Extensive experience with the software development lifecycle and process tools such as HPQC or other defect management tools  Experience developing BI solutions using leading BI tools such as OBIEE  Well versed in testing best practices and execution  Ability to obtain and maintain required security clearance Preferred:  1 year relevant consulting or industry experience  Experience optimizing ETL routines and environments  Experience administering and maintaining ETL environments  Understanding of Oracle BI Apps (Financials, Procurement, Inventory, Sales) How you'll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.
